pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:2.1: The nuns’ rules and their analysis
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:3.1: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:5.1: 25. The training rule on borrowed robes
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:6.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in the Jeta Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:6.2: At that time a nun, after walking for almsfood, spread out her wet robe and entered her dwelling.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:6.3: A second nun put on that robe and entered the village for almsfood.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:6.4: Soon afterwards the first nun came out and asked the nuns,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:6.6: The nuns told her what had happened,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:6.7: and that nun complained and criticized the second nun,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:6.8: “How can a nun put on my robe without asking for permission?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:7.1: She then told the nuns what had happened,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:7.2: and the nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:7.3: “How can a nun put on another nun’s robe without asking for permission?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:7.4: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:7.7: How can a nun put on another nun’s robe without asking for permission?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:7.8: This will not give rise to confidence in those without it …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:7.9: And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule thus:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:8.1: ‘If a nun wears a borrowed robe, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:9.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination by both complete Orders through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:10.2: if she wears any of the five robes belonging to a nun who is fully ordained, and it had not been given to her, nor had she asked for permission to use it, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:11.2: If the other person is fully ordained, and she perceives her as such, and she wears a robe belonging to her, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:11.3: If the other person is fully ordained, but she is unsure if she is, and she wears a robe belonging to her, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:11.4: If the other person is fully ordained, but she does not perceive her as such, and she wears a robe belonging to her, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:12.1: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she wears a robe belonging to her, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:12.2: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she perceives her as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:12.3: If the other person is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:12.4: If the other person is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive her as fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:13.8: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc25:14.1: The fifth training rule is finished.
